reviews.review_msg:
I am humbled by Dr. Whitehurst's move to Canada from the UK and really respect and am inspired by how he  leads health economics courses and conducts research here in a completely different healthcare system. 
I am grateful that he has inner knowledge on parts of my journey here as an international student from his personal experience relocating.

David seems easy-going because he is clear about expectations and friendly in his office but if he got the authority to take charge (which he deserves more than a few of the current officials), I know another much more intimidating side of him will come out to quickly improve faulty health policies and improve and unify the BC healthcare system.

I have so much respect for David's ability to lecture, he is incredible at holding the audience's attention and smoothly and confidently imparting his knowledge. I would be so grateful if he ran for a government position which allowed him to make very impactful decisions, I really believe in his ability to listen attentively and win public support.

His quizzes were really hard and avg were so low. Slides were posted after ONE unit (about 3 weeks of lectures) and I think the textbook is more important than his lectures. He is smart so he expects other people are smart too.

It's a really interesting course and he is good at clarifying questions students have. At first I didn't believe he was that good looking like some said, but this man is FINE with a capital F. The hot British accent adds to learning retention. Gorgeous gorgeous girls love to take health economics with Dr. Whitehurst.
